{{also|Appendix:Variations of "all"}} ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|en|enm|all-}} (also {{m|enm|al-}}), from {{inh|en|ang|eall-}}, {{m|ang|eal-||all-}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|al-}}, {{cog|de|all-}}, {{cog|sv|all-}}. More at [[all]]. ===Prefix=== {{en-prefix}} # Indicates [[complete]] [[power]] or [[authority]] in an area. #: [[all-knowing]] #: [[all-loving]] #: [[all-seeing]] #: [[all-powerful]] # Indicates that a term applies in a [[general]] manner. #: [[all-around]] #: [[all-over]] #: [[all-right]] ====Derived terms==== {{prefixsee|en}} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|to indicate complete power or authority in an area}} * Czech: {{t|cs|vše-}} * Russian: {{t|ru|все-}}, {{t|ru|обще-}} {{trans-mid}} * Scottish Gaelic: {{t|gd|uile-}} * Swedish: {{t|sv|all-}} {{trans-bottom}} {{trans-top|to indicate that a term applies in a general manner}} * Czech: {{t|cs|vše-}} * Russian: {{t|ru|все-}}, {{t|ru|обще-}} {{trans-mid}} * Scottish Gaelic: {{t|gd|uile-}} {{trans-bottom}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=all|LAL|Lal|Lal.}} ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== From {{m|et|all}}. ===Prefix=== {{head|et|prefix}} # located [[beneath]], at the [[bottom]], [[nether]], [[sub-]] ====Derived terms==== {{prefixsee|et}} ---- ==Icelandic== ===Prefix=== {{head|is|prefix}} # [[fairly]], [[rather]], [[decently]]{{jump|is|rather|s}} {{defdate|since the 17th century}} # {{lb|is|dated}} [[very]]{{jump|is|very|s}} #: {{ux|is|Ekki '''all'''fáir viðskiptavinir.|t='''Very''' many customers.}} ====Usage notes==== * [[hyphen|Hyphenating]] compound terms prefixed with {{m|is|all-}} is allowed (same with {{m|is|hálf-}}, {{m|is|jafn-}} and {{m|is|lang-}}):[http://www.rthj.hi.is/solofile/1011143 XIII. Bandstrik] ("hyphens") *: {{ux|is|'''All'''-óhugnanlegur.|t='''Rather''' gruesome.}} ====Synonyms==== * {{jump|s|is|rather}} {{l|is|sæmilega}}, {{l|is|heldur}}, {{l|is|nokkuð}} * {{jump|s|is|very}} {{l|is|mjög}}, {{l|is|einkar}} ====Derived terms==== {{prefixsee|is}} * {{l|is|allfár}} (''dated'', ''synonym'' ''[[mjög]] [[fár]]''; very few) * {{l|is|allgóður}} (''dated'', ''synonym'' ''[[mjög]] [[góður]]''; very good) * {{l|is|allgóður}} (''contemporary meaning'', ''synonym'' {{m|is|sæmilegur}}; decent) * {{l|is|allmikill}} (''contemporary meaning''; considerable) * {{l|is|allvel}} (''dated'', ''synonym'' ''[[mjög]] [[vel]]''; very well) * {{l|is|allvel}} (''contemporary meaning'', ''synonym'' {{m|is|þolanlega}}, {{m|is|sæmilega}}; reasonably) * {{l|is|enginn er allheimskur ef þegja má}} (no one is completely stupid if they can hold their silence; see [[silence is golden]]) ====See also==== * {{l|is|dá-||rather, fairly, quite}} ===References=== ---- ==Old Norse== ===Etymology=== From {{m|non|allr||all}}. ===Prefix=== {{head|non|prefix}} # {{non-gloss definition|used as an [[intensive]] in front of [[adjective]]s and [[adverb]]s}}; [[very]], [[extremely]] ===References=== * [https://archive.org/stream/concisedictionar001857#page/9 all-] in ''A Concise Dictionary of Old Icelandic'', G. T. Zoëga, Clarendon Press, 1910, at [https://archive.org/details/concisedictionar001857 Internet Archive].
